Key Arguments: The legislation grants excessive power to ACMA, potentially leading to censorship and prosecution for expressing opinions.
The bill contradicts international human rights agreements, particularly Article 19 of the ICCPR, which protects freedom of expression.
There is a history of abuse of similar laws in Australia, such as vilification and COVID-era laws, which have been used to silence dissent.
The bill represents governmental overreach and is akin to authoritarian regimes, threatening the free society and free press.
The legislation unfairly exempts the government and mainstream media from scrutiny while targeting independent media.
Notable Quotes: This is simply unfathomable in a supposed first world democracy and the Bill in its current form is open to extreme abuse.
Freedom of speech is a cornerstone of a free society and until recently, was recognised as such by all free societies.
This is an extremely dangerous bill and has no place in a free society.
